overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a pragmatic approach to time-series forecasting under constraints, starting with advanced model considerations (SARIMA, Prophet) but ultimately adopting a simple averaging method due to data limitations and computational restrictions. The analysis effectively identifies key patterns but shows limited sophistication in trend handling, relying on heuristic pattern replication for the forecast.
common_data_patterns: Dips during early hours (00:00-05:00) and afternoon (12:00-15:00)
key_insights: Identification of 24-hour seasonality as the dominant pattern
Use of daily averages to compensate for limited data (4 days)
Explicit acknowledgment of weekly pattern limitations due to insufficient historical data
Pattern replication as a fallback strategy when advanced models are infeasible
Data rounding for consistency with input formatting
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex: Combines initial advanced model considerations with detailed data pattern analysis, but simplifies to heuristic execution due to constraints. Includes multi-step validation of seasonality and stationarity.
